org.tmotte.tmplz

Class Section

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.tmotte.tmplz.node.CatNode
      • org.tmotte.tmplz.node.CatNodeSection
        • org.tmotte.tmplz.Section
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Appender

    public class Section
extends CatNodeSection
implements Appender

    Section is the main class used to manipulate Tmplz templates. A Section contains Slots and other Sections. Templates themselves are instances of Section; use TemplateManager to obtain a template.

    Slots in a template are filled in via the fillin() methods, and Sections are shown via the show() method.

    • Constructor Summary

      For internal use.

    • Method Detail

      • setObjectFormatter

        public void setObjectFormatter(ObjectFormatter obj)

        As a convenience feature, ObjectFormatter.format() will be invoked every time Section.fillin() is invoked. This allows one to intercept Slot values provided to fillin() and format them. setObjectFormatter() is recursive, so that it will be invoked on all Sections contained by this Section, whether they are currently visible or not.

        Note that this can also be done for all templates using TemplateManager.setObjectFormatter

        Parameters:
        obj - An ObjectFormatter that can format Slot values.
        See Also:
        TemplateManager.setObjectFormatter(org.tmotte.tmplz.util.ObjectFormatter)

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Provides the name of the Section as defined in its template; e.g., for [$Section Foo] returns "Foo".
        Specified by:
        getName in class CatNode
        Returns:
        The section name.

      • show

        public Section show(java.lang.String name)
        Obtains a named Section from this Section, makes it visible and returns it. This method may be invoked with the same Section name any number of times; each time after the first, a copy is made of the original Section and appended to it.

        It makes no difference what order different Sections are shown in; for example, this:
         
        mySection.show("A"); 
        mySection.show("B");

        has the same result as this:

                mySection.show("B"); 
        mySection.show("A");
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the contained Section to show.
        Returns:
        The contained Section.
        Throws:
        NoSuchSectionException - if the named Section is not found.

      • hasSection

        public boolean hasSection(java.lang.String name)
        Finds out if this Section contains another Section with the specified name.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of a Section to find.
        Returns:
        true If this Section contains another Section named name.

      • fillin

        public Section fillin(java.lang.String name,
             java.lang.Object value,
             boolean recursive)

        Sets the value of a Slot in this Section. If the Slot is defined in a template as [$Slot Foo], then fillin("Foo", "bar", true, false) will put "bar" into the Slot.

        If multiple Slots have the same name, all will be filled in.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the Slot, minus the "Slot" part.
        value - Will be placed in the Slot. If this is an Appender, its appendTo() will be invoked when the template is printed, allowing greater efficiency; otherwise, it will be toString()'d.
        recursive - If true, will drill down into contained Sections and look for Slots with the specified name. Sections that are not set to visible (ref. Section.show()) will not be drilled into.
        Returns:
        The same Section object, for convenience (Section is nonetheless "mutable").
        Throws:
        NoSuchSlotException - When no matching Slot is found and recursive is false.
        See Also:
        Appender

      • fillin

        public Section fillin(java.lang.String name,
             java.lang.Object value)
        The most commonly used version of fillin(). Does the same as fillin(name, value, false).

      • fillin

        public Section fillin(java.util.Map namesValues,
             boolean recursive)
        For each key and value in the given Map, invokes fillin(key.toString(), value, recursive) using the key as the name parameter. This method will not throw an exception if the key is not found in this Section or its sub-Sections.
        Parameters:
        namesValues - Keys are names of Slots to fill in; values are what to fill them in with.

      • fillin

        public Section fillin(java.util.Map namesValues)
        Invokes fillin(namesValues, false).

      • hasSlot

        public boolean hasSlot(java.lang.String name)
        Queries the template for the existence of a named Slot.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the Slot to find.
        Returns:
        true if this Section contains a Slot named name

      • replace

        public Section replace(java.lang.String name,
              java.lang.Object value,
              boolean recursive)

        This provides a slightly different functionality from fillin(). It was designed primarily for use by TemplateInterceptor instances that want to fill in a Slot "permanently", so that all copies of the template have the same value in the specified Slot.

        Normally, when a Section is duplicated via Section.show(), all of the Slot values in the copied Section are reset to null, even if fillin() has been used to set values on the original Section. The replace() method acts just like fillin(), but the Slot is converted into a static text element (CatNodeStatic) that retains its value when copied.

        When recursive is true, Slots in sub-sections will be filled in even if the Section is not visible (note that fillin() does not do this).

        The replace() method can only be invoked once against a Slot of a given name.

        Values passed into the Section via replace() will not be sent to the Section's ObjectFormatter (if any exists) for modification.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the slot.
        value - The value to place in the Slot
        recursive - If true, will drill down into contained Sections and look for Slots with the specified name.
        Returns:
        Section The same Section, for convenience.
        Throws:
        NoSuchSlotException - When no matching Slot is found and recursive is false.
        See Also:
        TemplateInterceptor

      • appendTo

        public void appendTo(java.lang.Appendable a)

        Prints the Section and all of its child nodes. Does not render the Section if it is not "visible"; the root Section of a template is automatically visible, and so are any Sections within it that have been "shown" via the show() method. Empty Slots are not rendered.

        If a TemplateInterceptor has been assigned, TemplateInterceptor.preRender(Section) will be invoked with this Section before rendering starts.

        Specified by:
        appendTo in interface Appender
        Parameters:
        a - The Appendable to print to.
        See Also:
        TemplateManager.setTemplateInterceptor(org.tmotte.tmplz.util.TemplateInterceptor)

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Invokes appendTo() with an internal buffer, and returns the result.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The rendered Section.

      • getSectionNames

      • getSlotNames
